values:
I am replaying odin sphere... 


So.
Good.

I google on how to match clothing with which accessories... and how to be a good shift supervisor... 


I'm pretty sure i'm not alone on this but it feels somewhat handy yet pathetic at the same time.

FUCKING lazy. 


I make walls for myself. 

 Whenever I am about to do work, instead of just doing it and trying really hard...which is what i expected before going into this program... I fear all the work that is ahead of me. Before i went into animation... i thought the hard work was going to be fun! I always thought it was before... Although i have to say... learned how to procrastinate hard. 

I have to learn how to make hard work fun. It will always be difficult and long..but not trying at all is making my skill set worse and my habits worsen. I am scared of...burning out. I wonder if i should keep working my ass off...anyways... even though i may fail. STUPID me. Thinking about giving up... putting up more walls. 

I have to stop blaming other people.
I am now in a better situation. 
I have to look and be better. 

GYAD i also have to lose weight. 

WORk on your DAMN ESSAYS, ASHLEY! WORK DAMN YOU! You.. have to at LEAST Do your ..friggin.. stupid... what are they called... Electives!!!!
DO THEM NOW!!!

I used to know that working hard built friendships. It made you suffer with everyone else...and also make them love you back... even chris lee (rain of animation) is doing better than me this year. I should shape up.. and not be such a turd. Can I do it? Can i work hard? Can I stop being such a sucker for emotions and social things? 

I have to stop conforming... 
I have to become great...
I must stand out...
I want to be better. Act. Do. Speak. 

Be the person i wanted to be... hard working, humble, and fantastic.

((staring at my essay half an hour later: FUCKING ... WORK GADDAMNED YOU!!!))

Ah, yes. It has definitely been a while since I've updated anything. I think everyone has changed and grown hopefully for the better! I am currently somewhat struggling in motivation with my fourth year film. It's like I must do this for some reason every semester. When will the madness stop!?

During my procrastination, i have been watching the following shows:

- how i met your mother
- big bang theory
- 30 rock


Fa-antastic!

My sister just had a baby, named Tadgh.  *pronounced 'taig' like tiger*   Why they screwed the kid up with a cool sounding name with spelling that no one will ever read out right unless they're Gaelic Irish? The kid will enjoy the name, nonetheless. 

Random note:
What I've learned over the summer was that in the past 4 years, apparently i had been the 'safe' friend to some of my girlfriends. I was the one who was in a long term relationship, didn't really care for wearing any sort of stylish attire, and was physically not a threat. 

... 

I have received some negative attention, since then. 

This is what happens when you associate with drama queens. They're fun and exciting at first, but then you get sucked into their drama-filled lives.

I refuse to listen to anyone's life problems in the animation program from now on. (i.e. gossip, relationship troubles, etc)

This will prevent me from getting involved in anyone's issues.

No Suprises - by Radiohead


A heart that's full up like a landfill, 
a job that slowly kills you, 
bruises that won't heal. 
You look so tired-unhappy, 
bring down the government, 
they don't, they don't speak for us. 
I'll take a quiet life, 
a handshake of carbon monoxide, 

with no alarms and no surprises, 
no alarms and no surprises, 
no alarms and no surprises, 
Silence, silence. 

This is my final fit, 
my final bellyache, 

with no alarms and no surprises, 
no alarms and no surprises, 
no alarms and no surprises please. 

Such a pretty house 
and such a pretty garden. 

No alarms and no surprises (get me outta here), 
no alarms and no surprises (get me outta here), 
no alarms and no surprises, please. 
 
<lj-embed id="33"/>

<lj-embed id="32"/>

Wise words about friendships and relationships in life. It reminds me much of the many things that have happened over the past years and those kinds of things will still happen years to come. It is preformed by this comedian/writer/actor who cross-dresses to play the Madea in the family. Much like a nana or grandmother. Yes it's a bit "cultural" but it's quite cute. Watch it if you've ever been hurt before... meaning everyone.

It's the first 5 mins that is worth watching.

For chris's birthday I made a HUUUUUUUUGe scrap book, bought season 4 dvds of house, and ACDC rock band. Dude.. that scrap book took me MONTHS to make. I have to say though, i'm glad i made it, but at the same time, i sacrificed SO MANY DUE DATES and hwk being done on time for it. AUGH exhausting. Plus i've only had 3$ in my account since the beginning of november. 

Update on our film:
The people in my group film is doing alright but no one except two people can storyboard. Yes it's a rough and now the editing process is being done but too bad, it's only the most important part of this whole operation. Robin is horrible at boarding but won't let anyone criticize him. But, Ti loves to disagree with people so when she steps up and overly insults a huuuuge 300 pd guy, arguments break out. 

Man i'm starving.... I ran out of cup ramyun... This miiiiight be a good thing but i need food. I made muffins but i gave most of them away. I've perfected the recipe for banana chocolate chip muffins based off of my friend's recipe.

You know those people who make themselves feel better by making others feel like shit!? I have to deal with him. Stupid... #$#$*%&&#(@~*@&~&@&@^$! Rude... Overly-sensitive... lying... insecure... pompous... BASTARD! i hate hate hate assholes... especially ones that think so highly of themselves!


I vow to never let that bastard make anyone feel so lowly ever again. I'm going to stand up to that biatch and never let that person get away with it! I will NEVER make friends with crazy people ever again. Man! Ever feel like some of the people you've known for a while ... end up turning crazy? Sometimes it's because of the new friends they hang out with... Sometimes it's because of wierd 'issues'... But There is NO excuse for turning into a jackass towards anyone. 

I used to feel powerless towards those kinds of people, but that is NO MO! I will never let you demean me or my friends! 


(stars and flashing lights fly behind me)

Oh! and watch this!

<lj-embed id="31"/>

This is a fourth year animation film from sheridan. This guy was hired straight away into pixar. It's so random... but i love it!!!

Whoa. It's wierd having that title... I'm a third yeeeearrr... (((hears the leaves rustle outside))). It's kinda nice but now that i look back, i have no idea why i worshipped the feet on which the 3rd and 4th years walked upon. This year, I'm kinda dreading homework and group work politics this year. But, i'm going to try and be on top of that. Plus, my life drawing teacher said that he'll make me the best life drawer in class if I going to extra life drawing classes everyday. DUDE... that's 3 hours of my time besides my classes, everyday! When the hell do i make room for homework?!

We're about to be put into groups next week and at the same time, getting ready for co-op this summer. Scaaarryyyy. All my classes are scheduled for 9am - 4/5pm everyday. I'm kinda overwhelmed but at the same time, slightly excited. 


My body hurts every morning trying to wake up. I get cranky and insecure when i'm tired. Maybe it's because i feel vulnerable. i live with three boys and as much as i love them, being the only girl will always feel left out in some way. (Although i'm having a lot of fun gaming with them or joking around). AUGH, I can't wait until i'm done school. 

My older sister is moving to toronto around october or november. I can't believe the whole friggin family will be back in one city. Gross... (in a loving kinda way).

On another note, I'm going through a learning stage in this time and life where i'm realizing who are real friends and who aren't. Before i was in college, i was the "Anyone can be my friend" - person. Then fights, lies, and wierd misunderstandings happened. I lost myself in all this and  lost all trust in myself and others. Finally, I just got over the "dont trust anyone" stage and am just starting to accept the idea of not having to try so hard to be someone's friend. No one should ever try so hard to make someone feel loved or trusted. It's not just up to you but that person as well to trust you, right? It should just be natural. If you don't naturally get along with that person - sometimes you just have to let go. It doesn't mean you can't be on good terms, just ... not close close anymore. 

Guys do this. It's kinda simple in a lazy way. 

I think i've learned my lesson on procrastination... again. lol! I don't think i deserve to say such a thing, but you know what i mean. GAD i talk such shit when it comes to promising not to procrastinate. It's in my genes. I learned it from my family and parents.  

Roommate quote of the week: 
Clayton (the asian clown of the basement)
*while playing smash brothers*
"I touched patricia's ship and i EXPLODED"
Dress Up Games for girls. Fashion and makeover games

Your Score: Mystic Knight

You scored 61% physical, 65% magic, 38% versatile, and 44% good!

Also known as the Sorceror. You prefer a healthy balance of mental and physical training. As a reult, you are uniquely able to apply the mystic arts to your fighting style, imbuing your weapon with elemental magic, or the ability to hurt your opponent in a number of interesting ways.

Link: The Final Fantasy Job Class Test written by Artscrafter on OkCupid, home of the The Dating Persona Test
View My Profile(Artscrafter)
i'm... I'm a mystic knight???

Man, now that i don't have classes, i'm too lazy to write entries, nowadays! Sorry, small things have been bothering me lately. It has to do with moving to another place, the price being much higher, and we have to paint it. BLUH! My new roommates will be D, Di, and Clayton. Wierd! No girls in the house! This is the first for me except whenever i go to chris's place. My carpet is a 70's chocolate brown (yuck... but comfortable) and the walls are painted a nasty pale - dirty yellow. It makes the rooms seem dark and gross, probably from the lack of light. I'm not used to no light!!! 

Lately, I've discovered online T.V. broadcasting! It's been around for a while, but i just haven't jumped on it yet. I've googled up some Korean, J-pop, and other sites. I was hoping to find an anime stream (hehehehehe) but it doesn't look like it exists. Instead, i'm stuck with a lot of news and music video broadcasts. I guess it's better than nothing. 

I miss tv. I know... i know... there's a lot of useless crap, but it raised me.

I've been watching channels such as Oh!samaTV, JapanARadio, and ArirangTV. I think my dad would be proud of me hearing a korean radio show. 

You can check them out but i've got to warn you, half the time either your cable won't be able to handle a certain channel. 

http://wwitv.com/portal.htm

Food poisoning has introduced me to my new best friend... the toilet. 

My new enemy? 



FOOOD!!!!!
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGh

amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad amagad .... i dropped... CONGEE!!! I was bringing him over to my bed and then he flipped out of my arms and onto the ground! He froze for about 5 seconds, twitched, then flipped over in fright. Poor baby! He seems fine now but i ain't handling him unless putting him in the ball for the next couple of days This is the other hamster i was considering. Look how cute and funny it looked at me! So sweet and fat! I think i like little fat things.

*** On the right is chris's reaction to seeing himself on the website after Dana-sama told me on the phone and i showed him on skype.  He's a celebrity now!


  


If you don't mind me saying, i think this is a fantastic picture of him.
You can see it here:   http://www.hobbystar.com/fanexpo2008/gaming/index.html

I, on march 6th 2008, adopted a teddy bear hamster. It's about 3 months old and is white and beige. It's a long-haired hamster and it leewwwvves lettuce. It was really sweet and quite docile while handling it. I fell in love when i was first holding it.  I bought a pretty big cage without a starter's kit so i had to buy everything from scratch. 


It's so sweet! It's a big fall of soft fluff and it loves to eat. Lately his temperment has gotten much better! He gets really excited when i come near the cage. He expects fresh vegetables and yogurt drops.  But, now i think he actually wants to come out too. 

I will post pictures sometime this week. 


He brings me a lot of joy and i'm much happier in oakville with him. He's my companion and friend (or more like a fluffy baby) and he eases the loneliness i feel here in this hick town. My very good friend Leepoy ( possibly one of the nicest and sincerest person i've ever met and you'd all love) bought treats for it and a nest. It kinda just likes to pass through the nest because it's a bit too small. I think he really needs one of those hamster homes because i think he'd feel a lot more secure and happier with his privacy. 



on another note, i'm doooooomed from all the assignments!

Name: Pi Lo Chun (Spring Green Snails) Tea Type: Green tea origin: two mountains in the west part of Dongting in Jiangsu province, China Color: Light Yellow-green Smell: Deep aroma, honey, sweet, light, (apparently apricot-y but... it's honey), hint of green tea smell Taste: Sweet, hint of herbal notes, low in acidity compared to other teas, peachy My roommate Tim, got this tea from China from his grandfather. Apparently this tea originated from their home town. I'm drinking it now and it tastes... simply for the lack of the better word... joygasm. I highly recommend it. I would probably imagine that this tea would go well with desserts or fruits very well. According to tenren.com, Pi Lo Chun tea was named by a chinese king who felt that steeped tea leaves looked like snails. This high grade tea is about 31$ for 100g. None of the leaves were broken and were dried in a swirl curl. The leaves didn't really open up, though... that might be bad on my part, but i have no clue. On a side note: I was watching the first two episode of Sky girls. Then i thought to myself, if i were to save a town and they wanted to give me a bunch of rare nuts, i would say, "Bitch, give me some of your tea"! http://www.tentea.com/pilochungree.html

Orlando Bloom goes on a very popular late night show in England. He's interviewed by Graham Norton who often shows fan's letters, photos, etc. This is his third appearance on Mr. Norton's show and this clip is just hilarious!!!

Bloom fans pretend to have dated/flirted/know him personally. Ahhh yes. I wonder if the girls have seen it. A fangirl's dream come true? Or rather, a nightmare...

Watch it!


p.s. doesn't Orlando look as though he's being tickled/choked around his neck whenever he laughs?

There's something so appealing about making really buttery toast with hot soup on a cold winter day. 

mmm


butter



Man, lately people have been too busy to blog. I guess it's because everyone is in TORONTO doing STUFF and GOING to places ... really really fast! *folds arms 

and maybe driving cars!

<lj-embed id="28" />

"I am Prince Caspian..."
XD
Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee hee

They made this character play a much more sexier role than i thought he'd be portrayed. But, that's Disney producers for you... 

Have any of you read some if not all of the Narnian Chronicle books? I think i've probably read up to... the book after this one... When i saw this trailer, i'm actually anticipating it quite  a bit. I hope they don't make the romance scenes too much cheese, though. It's also about bloody time they start working on angsty scenes and characters! Ahhhh-prince caspian... I'm actually kind of suprised that they didn't make "A Horse's boy" first which tells the tale of how Prince Caspian came to be. I think it's a lot better, personally as a story.

I have mentally prepared myself for classes this time. I'm ready to take on much of the work... If i just only could finish the leftovers from last semester asap! What i'm really excited about this term is learning digital painting, yay! FINALLY i'll be able to really learn how to paint on photoshop and all those fancy shmancy drawing/painting applications. But dammitall why do i have such a poor sense in color? maybe it's because i never actually ever had a natural eye for it.


maybe i can actually start posting up stuff i feel is somewhat worthy.

A couple weeks ago i accidentally downloaded a virus onto my computer. I tried reformatting it this week but only to find out that i didn't have software for my ethernet card. Thus, Hiru chan had to find it for me and send it to me via school computers. I also left my phone charger at his place so i've had no way of contacting anyone. My cable-less t.v. and playstation were all that could keep me company through the lonely nights. It's terrible living away with no phone or internet with an apartment FULL of people who aren't particularly close to you unless you spoke mandarin.

We also now have a new life drawing teacher.

...

WHERE HAS HE BEEN ALL MY LIFE?! He's AMAZING!!! OH MAN! (if you have been keeping up with my entries, the last life drawing teacher was originally a fine arts teacher. Meaning she was horrible at life drawing and knew nothing of real human anatomy). Everyone (especially me) were blushing half the class cause we were all so happy. It doesn't mean that aaaaaaall the info that he threw at us about the muscles and whatnot weren't overwhelming. I feel that most of us will fail this exam next week - but we'll all end up better artists at the end of this semester.

It's 11:13pm with temperatures just below zero on the eighth floor of my apartment in Oakville. 

The fire alarm in my building is going off... 

I got out of my room, stood in front of my roommates, and looked at each other. 

We all knew the question I was about to ask them which was whether or not we should all evacuate the building. 


"We'll die together."


And then we went back in our rooms.

Hay hay! Since i have started knitting, this is my first creation: I sewed all of the holes up with yarn and put it together to make a cup warmer/holder thingy! Here's the second thing i 've made with no holes but with very uneven edges. A coaster! Yaaaay! My next new thing is a scarf! Whoppas! I've gotten about 60cms from a week since i haven't had a lot of time to knit but it's getting there. Astrael_nyx - chan posted up videos of south park FINALLY making a spoof on guitar hero... and i must say... it was no disappointment. AUGH it was hilarious! In September when I was sort of homesick, I started to upgrade my room a little. So, I put up random pictures, put up nature-y shapes and whatnot. Yay! I have a cute room. Yes, it doesn't look like pictures from Ikea catalogs but i can't really do that much on a very low budget. Btw, thank God for thumbtacks. You can hammer it in only to have a very small and very unnoticeable hole. Look at the boxes! i put faces on them inspired by this box-plushie company. I'm going to one day paint them with left over paint and then pain the faces on properly. My computer's hard disk failed on me several days ago so i lost all my pictures, files, music, videos, memories... everything. So, Hiru-chan came over and fixed it for me. Yay! It almost feels as though i have a new computer. GUH! but all those pictures! whoppas

Ya know, as i've come to talk to you and got to know you a bit better, I'm really liking you more and more! I think you've always been such a sweet, funny, and charming girl who just can't get enough out of the materialistic things out of life! 

Thank you for always being you and never changing.... except adding onto your endless list of obsessions. 
And, as you grow this year and you're out of school (for now), i hope you learn incredible things.

Keep obsessing! Be proud! You make people around you smile and obsess too.

Hiru Chan just yesterday bought me some knitting needles and yarn! I'm so eager to create but as soon as I saw the instruction booklet, i immediately went on the internet. After failing trying to look at pictures only, I sought videos. They were so much better, but damn. This is how my first knitting self taught session started:

8:30 am learned how to cast. It's pretty darn easy if you ask me!
9:00 am tried to do the first row
9:15 am tried to do the first row again
                    (does that for every 15 mins for the next 3 hours)
12:15 pm Got the first row done! But still looks shitty


I think i need someone here to actually show me what to do. I think i'm doing it totally wrong because I can't even seem to make a coaster.

<lj-embed id="25" />


***Laughing

I got this from a gay friend.

I'm going...


to learn....


how to knit.                                            


Isn't that wonderful?


Lately, I've begun this obsession as of how to make my room look more comfortable. I started cutting out shapes similar to that of vector art out of origami paper Chris bought me. I'm taping them on my walls and it looks as though I have a nice theme going on. I'll probably post pictures later. But yah! Now that I'm starting to run out of room on my walls, I need another hobby. Something that'll benefit me. Thus, I've decided to take up knitting my own gloves or scarves. I'm so excited! I've actually thought about this for a very long time.

OOH OOH I got a new cell phone from my sister! It's the Sony Ericson k790a. People can finally call me now. If you want my number, just msg me or something. It has a really good camera on it so you'll all be seeing a bit more pics. My first phone AND camera. Yay~

I hope everyone has been good. I miss you all.

<lj-embed id="24" />

What if everyone had an animal - depending on your ethnicity, family, bloodline, and your personality. WOULDN'T THAT ROCK?!?!? They'd never be more than a few feet away from you and you were two-of-a-kind?

What do you think? Do you think it's me?

From all of my sisters in my family, I actually look a lot more like my uncle for some reason. I have the smallest no-lid eyes (which is wierd because everyone has lids and have med to big eyes), I am the heaviest (and that makes my dad pick on me more about diets), the biggest nose (which is a mixture of my dad's big nose and my mom's round one), and I'm the youngest.

This means that all my sisters and my parents look at me in such a way that I got all the bad left overs or something. WHATEVER! I think that's why i've grown up avoiding or fearing koreans.

It took a long time for me to accept myself for who i am and love the things I have. A very long time. ... Esp since my parents are the very old fashioned korean parents. You koreans know what i mean... The ones that like to honneh (lecture) you about every little thing and call you very cold things. It's those ajimas (adult-old ladies) that said those things to you, have grabbed my stomach fat with their hands out of no where telling me how I could lose it.

Are they living my life? Do they really discern whether I or anyone else's child is pretty or not? Raise your children to be healthy, confident, and happy kids. Not one that had to feel as annoyed about their looks when they really didn't have to.

***This was a response to Kimchi Mama's blogspot where Nabi mama talks about her issues with her mother and her mother's friends.



      I came across this music video and the lyrics (which were probably written by someone else) really hit me. I seriously could relate to the words that were sung. Because for the majority of the beginning of my relationship, I avoided trying to get too attached and showing any signs of vulnerability. I struggled with my feelings for him. I had this need to distance and protect myself. I didn't really know what this feeling was.

      Every time I hinted at him with a romantic notion of my feelings for him, it sort of... well, lets just say we should all know by now that you can't hint things with men. Thus, I tried so hard to deny any sort of hopes and dreams with us being together. I'd secretly daydream of one of us dissapointing each other by either changing our feelings for one another or even to the extremes of unfaithfulness, very often((mainly being his fault)). lol. All girls are a little witchy, mind you.

      But obviously during these 3 years, things have happened and those walls have been slowly broken down. I, as any person in a relationship, still have those fears once in a while but they've been pretty much put to rest. New feelings and new hopes have budded and grown to new areas in my life.
 
      In this music video sung by Rihanna, called "I hate that I love you", was something that i personally could understand and relate to at one point in my life. Enjoy!



     With the way Rihanna is tossing and turning? How she's waiting and starring at the time? When she just can't stop thinking about him no matter where she goes? She's not dying, she's being mentally tortured!

     So, people who are getting pressured by their friends, parents, of whatever - Don't rush for it. It's not easy. It's a turmoil and hurricane of emotions that hit you like a big friggin truck in the face.


p.s. I don't so much "hate" it anymore. :
: )

This is a hilarious music video made from the t.v. hit show Star Trek.. ... high... on shrooms. 

<lj-embed id="21" />

I'm not personally one to be into videos and songs about drugs, but this is an exception. This and the one about Captain Kirk and Spok being gay for each other. I personally think it's probably made by the same person, but hey! I got a kick  out of this one too.

Do you girls remember that naive feeling of wanting to be princessy-pretty? C'mon, you know you watched sailor moon, ladies. (((Men who watched sailor moon are excluded because we all know 2 reasons why you'd ever watch it!)))

it was sparkly, pretty, ribbony, and had lots of really pretty hair!


...I barely remember it

Do you know what's a curse? having the roundest face in the family, with the smallest eyes, and biggest nose. They tell you everywhere that you need volume on top of your head for round shaped heads. Hooray! I have no volume in my hair - it's thin, and tough.

sonnnnova betch!

I went to my all-time favourite hair stylist, Amanda. FUCK! She nearly doubled her price from 25$ to 40$. Then, she seems to be really popular so she's forgotten quality in cut rather than the whole shampooing bit which they force you to  do (which you are paying for). I remember her cutting my hair like it was artwork to her. She carefully cut to perfection! So perfect that the cut was great for a whole year. But, after just a week of my hair being cut from her turned limp. Lifeless. Barely any change. I can't notice a thing.

It's so unfair!

So..... SOOOOO unfair.

I think she was in a bad mood too at the time! BUT  so what!?  I friggin recommended so many people to her. Now i'm left with even more useless shapeless layers.


The hair! They do naaathing!


On a side note: the working thing...is...sort of not working atm.

AUGH! I have this "i'm better than everyone else"-clique in my class. They're all made of men, oddly enough, and they're quite the assholes with the exception of one or two. We went on a ROM trip today and i'm pretty damn sure they made fun of me when hot sauce accidentally squirted on me when i was purchasing a hot dog. I hope you drop dead!


*sigh

I just handed in my two week's notice to my boss (...more like his mail box). I 'm pretty darn sure he read it and is probably upset since so many people have quit. He needs to friggin start hiring a lot more people, then! Obviously not just anyone, but he's just totally being way too picky. If he's the one who hire Ayla, then you have no judgment of character. Although I'm glad that I'm going to a starbucks nearby my school, I'm sort of sad because i've just started getting comfortable with the people on the one in downtown. I really really liked working with Brett, Jonathan, Christi, and more. They were so sweet and made my shift so easy (not that i didn't work hard!... which i did!). 

I"m going to miss those guys. ... *sniff...


But one thing i won't miss is my boss's temper.

BRRR!

As I go into 2nd year of Sheridan's animation course, I'm slowly seeing my life starting to revolve around it. I have so many different interests and hobbies that I'm going to miss, yet I think this is my step into finally accepting the fact that this will be my life. I am trying to accept the fact that I'll be seeing Chris less because of school and work, but then, no one ever really does. I even tried googling "how to not miss your boyfriend" and the only answer i got was something along the lines of, "The only way you'll miss your bf less is if you love him less". Since that's not happening, it's hopeless for me now!

The school wants me to post an animation blog so i can keep a network up. FACK! I can't post this blog! It's too personal! And all my other blog entries?! I'm going to have to restrict them too!? I'm lazy so keeping up with 2 different blogs is... sort of.. tiring.

I am up right now because passed out on my bed today. The cool thing about my apartment is the fact that I can just lie down on my bed, look up at the window, and i'm watching the sky and its clouds. I lav it! But i slept for about 4 hours and woke up only to discover it was night already. Then I drank some hot chocolate that Dana-sama gave me during the summer. It was nutty.

I got a mirror from Karen and dang. I'm so proud. I got a free mirror. Who gets free mirrors? me! Damn straight. Thanks Karen! I seriously love it. It's light and yet - it looks like a million dollars. It's not coo for a girl to not have a mirror in her room.

Oh, on a side note, my roommate Chu had sex with her bf in the washroom. The washroom... was so clean... that people felt the urge in the washroom... Fack! I have cleaning powers!

Did I mention in my previous entry that I washed the entire washroom like a friggin nazi? I made the washroom white again! I'm so proud. Remember people! Tilex does the job on shower tiles annnd toilet bowls. If you use it, though, try and not breathe it in. It made me quite dizzy. I think ever since then, I have gained authority in this apartment. My roommate Tim thought the washroom looked fine until he came in and saw what it should have looked like.

So proud!

HAPPY HAPPY BIRTHDAY STEP-pa-ni CHAN!

Truely... it has been a great ... almost 5 years now?
I'm so happy to have known  you! I think we were the first in the animanga club to talk about personal issues. WOOO HOO!

Thanks for always letting me confide in you and always being yourself around me. FACK YA! We're your fanclub!

I just closed from Starbucks and I think i'm finally starting to get to know people. At least some. I'm sort of giving up on trying too much to please them and just be as awkward as i want. WOOO! Screw it. Take me as I am. I think that's the best way, anyhow. Just be yourself.

      I think the lesbians know that I'm onto them. I was discussing about the different standards between the North American and Japanese societies. Then it was about manga and how the good ones usually have almost every type of sexual types (while i was holding fruits basket). Then one of them mentioned how she liked to watch gay porn. I was a little taken back from that very short comment, and then I realized that that might have been the start to being more open. I then continued the conversation after a very very brief pause and then told her what I liked/not liked about it. In other words, I think I pulled a Subha.



OOH OOH! I've come up with ideas for a couple of short comic strips. I was thinking about my reaction to watching (which I've just started today) PeaceMaker Kurogane, and a starbucks workplace one.

I'm very numb at the moment because I had to open the store this morning. I had a double shot of espresso, so i'm sort of paying for it now. I'm so excited for this fall's new seasons of Grey's anatomy and Heroes. 


Goooo Hiro!

 
    Lately, I've been having a lot of self-doubt. I'm scared that I won't do well this school year because I won't manage my time well. Because of that, I won't push myself to do better. In animation, it's not enough to just complete assignments. It's what you learn from them and how far you pushed yourself to make it better.

    I had this goal before I started this course, which was to inspire others around me. I haven't really been doing that at all since the workload hit. I think I'm just so obsessed with being comfortable, rather than challenging myself. 

    Is it possible to balance a job, friends, family, a love-life, and still manage to improve in art? Am I just not trying hard enough? What do i have to tell myself everyday in order to make that happen?

Damn you Grey's Anatomy! I just finished watching your latest season in tears and now i have to wait for you for a month. It just sucks you in and slaps you around. I love that show so much but the cliffhangers really do kill you. Thus, I'm up right now at 4am because I'm worried about the characters. People's breaking up with this person, people are cheating on that, someone had sex with this person's bf, etc. I love this show. I-lav-it! But everyone keeps fighting over the stupid guys! So, since Chris has "introduced" to me shows such as: Mahoromatic, house, 24, and many other girl-girl animes, I feel that I should fill in the role as a proper girlfriend and force him to watch Grey's friggin Anatomy. 

He'll like it... 
He'll like it a lot... 


He should be grateful it's not Gilmor girls, Passions, or Buffy the Vampire Slayer! ... Oops, Chris made me watch Buffy.   Myyyyy baaaad : D


On the side note: 

    Starbucks is a bitch, as usual. Half of the shift supervisors are harsh, very negative, and very cliquey. The other half which are all coincidentally gay make me look forward to work and getting paid. I have a lot of suggestions as to how to improve the quality of our starbucks at yonge and college but they have to do with mood, mannerisms, and attitudes. My starbucks manager sort of flipped out and now he's on vacation. DEAR GOD i hope he comes back refreshed and happier than ever-remembering his skills as to how to be a great manager. When he's angry - the whole store(workers only) look as though they've been hit with an earthquake. Suddenly the goals are uncertain. The shifts are sad and angry. 

     

p.s. Matt Damon! I know you were playing sudoku on the subway beside me on the week you were here to be in Jimmy Kimmel Live show on CTV!!! Just admit it. You were interested in the GTO manga i was reading. You just have to ask and I'll lend it to you! The only condition is that as hard as it might be for you, you have to try and not hit on me.
P.p.s. If anyone has the ikea catalog...just give it to me! PLEASE! ... I'm looking at you Matt!

*stares off into space

I feel so disgusted and unclean. I'm going to hope into the shower even though I have to wake up in about 4 hours to go back to work again. I.... augh... I just.. I'm so sad...right now

AUUUUGHHHHH AAAAAGHHHH ~! My dad said he knew the due date for my tuition! If he had just told me that he didn't know, i would have checked up on iiiiiiiit!!! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGH There's going to be a late fee and he'll blame meeeeee!!!! ((pulls hair)) OK! OK! Fine! I shouldn't have trusted my own dad. I should have just done it by myself. Now, I'm going to get in big friggin trouble! 

     I'm feeling a liiiiittle down today (Could you tell?). Partially because I've been over my bf's house for the past couple of days. Thus, my parents are really giving it to me. That's my fault, i know. I think my whole family is made up of procrastinators. I wondered where it all came from, and then i figured it out when I saw watched my parents one day scramble for my last year's tuition and income tax reports. Which, they blamed me for when it had to be rushed last minute. 

     I think when I watch my parents work so hard, it pushes me too. When they support me, I do the same thing. But when they totally do the opposite, I don't reciprcate to their expectations.

     Because I haven't been getting the same kind of support and guidance that I've had for so many years anymore, I'm slipping. I'm not as social, nor good at keeping very needy friendships, strong, or proud of myself as i used to be when i had that hand to guide me. What was this strong force? Honestly, I'll tell you it was God and Grandpa. Not that both of them aren't with me at all, it's just... I won't go on about that part. I thought I was good for the past few months. With my job in Starbucks, I had some hope. But that ended when i started to see my payroll and just about how much I'm really getting. 

     What really is starting to suck is i'm beginning to see my sister falling into a very twisted and evil relationship... which I won't go too deep into either. It's her choice. I'll be supportive. But that doesn't mean i have to like the guy. ((Don't even assume that you might know what the situation is, here.))

NOOOOO! The Korean fever is coming in one very messy spill!!! How? I came accross this video on youtube and it just blew me away. Stephen Colbert compares himself to the very famous korean r&b singer Rain. He goes on to compare him to N. Korea's leader by calling him "Rain Jong Il" ... That just about killed me. I don't know how Rain got on Time's Magazine's #1 on the 100 list of 2007's most influential people, but that's just crazy. Not only that, he's above Colbert! He even makes his own Korean music video. My favourite part of this vid is the very last line. I never really ever knew about Rain until Steph mentioned that he was coming to Toronto (which was recently cancelled) to preform live. Then, at Andrew's b-day, Rylan and Tim starts dancing to his music in a very corny and hilarious style. Thus, I was thinking about it randomly tonight and I felt the need to look up his music videos to check out what he's really about. He has some pretty nice cinematography in his mvs but I think his coreographer needs to bring a little more class into his cornball dance routines. I'm not saying that they're not impressive... just ... corny!

This is probably one of my favourite opera duet/duels so far. This clip is from a movie called Opera Bianca e Fernando. It's sung by Jerome Pruett. I have this feeling that it was entirely sung by him but he differentiated it a bit. One was a bit stiffer than the other. A funny thing my sisters and i remember from this movie is the fact that there's this one part in the clip where the one guy screws up. EUN (my oldest sister) would imitate him disgustingly well! It's hilaarrrrious. She'd sing it over and over and over. We'd be either flailing on the bed, or holding our knees laughing. If only i could tape it. She'd throw me through a wall... so I'm not sure if it'd be worth it. So basically, what happens in this part of the movie is the two best opera singers in Italy have retired, and have a bet on who could teach the next best singer . They made a very last minute rule to the bet the night (i think) before the duel. Whomever loses gets shot... or loses the girl. In order to create a fair competition, they must wear masks and outfits which will conceal their features. Wasn't that gorgeous? The only problem is when the main protagonist takes off the mask, from the song an audience would expect a very graceful, a very elegant man. Instead... you get... Count Chocula... Heeheehee ((watching this clip over and over)) I personally don't really like listening to Pavarotti. I tried. But He's... not that... ehh.. he sounds too old. But this song blows me away. It makes me feel somewhat hazy and happy. This is probably the best part in the movie. Count Chocula tends to act very gay when he's listening to the main girl sing. In fact, that's the exact same way my sister acts when she's listening to symphonies. He's great at lipsynch, though. If you want to see what I mean, you can watch Do you see!? When he opens his mouth and then bites his lips??? His little looks?!
